meanings.sent1: She could scarcely believe her eyes when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent2: I had scarcely enough time to finish my homework before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The magician could scarcely pull a rabbit out of his hat without dropping it.
meanings.sent4: The old house was so dark that light scarcely entered through the windows.
meanings.sent5: The child's whisper was so faint that it was scarcely audible.

meanings.definition: Only a very short time before.
meanings.sent1: The train arrived scarcely a minute after I reached the platform.
meanings.sent2: She had scarcely left the room when the phone started ringing.
meanings.sent3: The cake was in the oven for scarcely five minutes before it burned.
meanings.sent4: The sun had scarcely set when the stars began to appear in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had scarcely finished explaining the assignment when the bell rang.

meanings.sent1: He had scarcely any money left after buying the new video game.
meanings.sent2: There was scarcely any food left in the fridge for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The tiny plant had scarcely grown since it was planted last week.
meanings.sent4: The pond was so shallow that it was scarcely deep enough for swimming.
meanings.sent5: The cup was so small that it could scarcely hold a sip of water.
